title: 'FITBIT'

title: 'Black screen... Watch not starting :( after few months of use'
body: After only a few months of using this device, I encountered a frustrating issue: a black screen rendering it completely unresponsive. I attempted to revive it by holding the button on the side, but unfortunately, that did not resolve the problem. Despite searching online, I couldn't find any information on how to fix this seemingly common issue.  Given the price I paid, I had higher expectations regarding its durability and lifespan. At this point, I'm left with no choice but to request either a refund or a replacement from Fitbit. I will provide updates on the outcome, but for now, I can only give it a one-star rating.

title: 'Black screen of death?'
body: In just a few months of using this, got a black screen and it's totally dead. Tried resetting it by holding the button on the side, but that does not fit it. Couldn't find information on reviving this online, although it seems to be a common proble... I had expected to get a few years out of this for the price charged. Need either my money back or a replacement from fitbit. Will update on what happened, giving it 1 star for now.

title: 'One of the worst smart watches ever'
body: The media could not be loaded. This is unnecessary hype product it has nothing good to be called smartwatch just because the sensor it has . this watch will never connect to your phone you can clearly see in the video the notification bar still buffers it will never connect to your phone please buy a 5000 cheap watch if you have to but not this one, complete waste of money you don't get watch faces you cannot edit anything from the watch what is the use of a smartwatch then if everything I have to do it from my phone.

title: 'Wrong Step Count. Incorrect Zone minutes'
body: 'Versa 4 counts steps even if just shake the arm wearing the watch while we are just sitting.  Yesterday I was driving my car and did not di any exercises but Versa 4 reported as if I have done 451 minutes of intensive exercises..  This also happened a couple of more times. Looks like while driving Firbit Versa 4 thinks as if we are sprinting.  Very disappointed. Now the return window of Amazon is also over. Hope Fitbit team helps me fix this at the earliest or replace this with another products which works better.'

title: 'Not worth it !!!'
body: This is one product that is exorbitantly price and extremely inaccurate. Every time you swing the watch hand, it adds steps. If you ride a motorcycle, it assumes a bicycle workout. The pulse reading is off by a few points. The oxy meter said 124 while the watch read 110. The app doesn't support some of the features on Android 13. I contacted the developer team and they reassured me that a new version will sort things out but that too hasn't helped. My advice: BUY SOMETHING CHEAPER THAT IS MORE ACCURATE. I had some cheaper ones that were more accurate like the OnePlus. The strap is not great in that.

title: 'Good one!'
body: I've been using Versa 4 for a month now. It was hard decision to choose between versa 3 & 4. Since i wasn't upgrading any fitbit device I'm new to the fitbit community i went on with the latest buy versa 4. Gotta say I'm impressed so far. It mostly suits me for helping me change my sleeping routine which is very basic need but i used to suck at it!. Making the sleep patterns so accurate and in visual graphics make it easier for me to understand my sleep and how my body responds. Even though I'm the last person to go for a workout, this watch has made me way more active than before!

title: 'No support In India'
body: 'Fitbit do not have service support in India . If you encounter issue with the device after 1 year then you need to throw your device. I would suggest look for other brand'

title: 'FITBIT CUSTOMERS BEWARE'
body: Beware, Fitbit does not have a service centre and if ur watch battery drains out and refuses to take charge after a couple of years (as happened with my earlier Versa), u will have to throw it away. Also, local technicians are unable to repair. Feature wise it's a shame for the money charged. FITBIT PL WAKE UP BEFORE ITS TOO LATE..

title: 'From 8 years of being a loyal Fitbit fan to terminating my account with Fitbit'
body: 'Better avoid this and go for alternates
column5: please ensure you check if they have Service Centre\'s in your region before purchase.  I was a Fitbit customer
column6: based in India. My relationship with Fitbit started in 2014 with Surge
column7: loved the product and used for almost six years. Replaced the old Surge with a new one when it started to malfunction. Never dreamt of changing the device. Surge was perfect.  In 2020
column9: the latest then and things continued good. The issue started when I wanted to upgrade to Fitbit Sense 2. I wanted to wipe the data in Versa 2 before giving it to my family members.  Hit the Factory reset option to clear the data
column10: but the Versa 2 suddenly stopped responding. It refused to charge nor switch on after the Factory reset was hit. Promptly reached out to the Fitbit support team to get this repaired. After multiple email interaction
column11: this is what I understood.  There are no service centres for Fitbit in India. They replace faulty products only within warranty period
column12: which is 1 year from the date of purchase. If any issue arises post 1 year
column13: there is no support for the device.  As a user
column14: rarely one would go for factory reset once the device has been activated. It\'s either done if the data is not reading correct or if you are giving it to others. This normally doesn\'t happen with the year of purchase. There is very less opportunity to check if the device is faulty due to "Factory Reset" within the first year of purchase.  Finally email from Fitbit support team  "Thank you for letting us know about your recent experience with our product and I appreciate you taking time to share your concerns. We understand your situation. However
column15: we have a warranty policy that we need to follow. Once again
column16: we do apologize if we\'re unable to replace it. "  My suggestion to all future buyers
column17: please be weary of the fact that there is no service centre in India if you encounter any problem with device. You spend more than 20K and after 1 year you might be left high and dry
